problemStatement.plain: All twin prime pairs (p, p+2) with p > 3 have the form (6k-1, 6k+1) for some positive integer k. This is a structural result about twin primes using modular arithmetic.

proven: Structure theorem: twin primes > 3 satisfy p ≡ 5 (mod 6)

knowledge.progressSummary: Proved that all twin primes > 3 have the form (6k-1, 6k+1). Key insight: if p ≡ 1 (mod 6), then p+2 ≡ 3 (mod 6), so 3 divides p+2, contradicting primality.
